U: S. Rep. Joaquin Castro's statement in a public breakfast interview with the McAllen Monitor, where he expressed his concern about the slow pace of Congress and described 2013 as the least productive year in congressional history.
Confirmation from Castro: s staff, who cited news reports and an undated chart published by USA Today, which indicated that the 113th Congress had passed only 67 bills into law in 2013.
The audio clip provided by Castro: s spokeswoman, Laura Zapata, which contained the exact statement made by Castro at the breakfast interview and supported his claim of low productivity in Congress.
The report from the National Journal: published on December 19, 2013, which stated that the output of the 113th Congress in 2013 was significantly lower compared to the number of bills introduced by lawmakers, further supporting the claim of a lack of productivity.
